meanings.definition: Situated on or toward the back and side of an animal or structure.
meanings.sent1: The dorsolateral fins of the fish help it steer through the water.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel climbed the tree using its dorsolateral strength.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to scratch its dorsolateral back but ended up chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper's dorsolateral windows offered a breathtaking view of the city below.
meanings.sent5: The hiker admired the dorsolateral cliffs that rose majestically beside the trail.

meanings.definition: Relating to or located on the side of the body or a body part that is away from the midline.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the dorsolateral area of the patient's knee for any swelling.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly's wings displayed beautiful dorsolateral patterns.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly referred to the burnt pizza crust as the dorsolateral edge of flavor.
meanings.sent4: The tree's branches reached out in a dorsolateral embrace, providing shade for the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The car's side mirror reflected the dorsolateral view of the passing landscape.
